intro: Amphithalea speciosa, commonly known as the showy amphithalea, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of clusters of small, tubular flowers arranged in cymes. Native to regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
